title: Prepare for Oral Argument
description: An attorney is preparing for an oral argument before an appellate court and needs to anticipate potential questions from the judges.

tasks.description: Review all the briefs filed by both sides in the appeal.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent has a deep understanding of all arguments.

tasks.description: Identify the weakest points in their own argument and the strongest points in the opponent's argument.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent pinpoints the most challenging aspects of the case.

tasks.description: Brainstorm a list of 10-15 difficult questions the judges are likely to ask, focusing on the identified weak points.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent generates a list of potential questions.

tasks.description: Draft concise and persuasive answers to each potential question.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent creates a prep document to be used in a moot court session.
